intro: Popowia lastoursvillensis, commonly known as the Lastoursville popowia, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is found in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
